content.en: Assistive navigation algorithms: Researchers are exploring how algorithms can assist blind and visually impaired individuals in navigating their surroundings. These algorithms use vision technology to detect path borders, obstacles, fiducial marks, and color-coded markers. They also calculate velocity and direction, offer navigation information, and provide precise positioning. By integrating these algorithms into wearable devices, mobile applications, and augmented reality systems, researchers aim to improve the mobility and independence of visually impaired individuals in both indoor and outdoor environments.
content.da: Assistive navigation algoritmer: Forskere undersøger, hvordan algoritmer kan hjælpe blinde og svagtseende personer med at navigere i deres omgivelser. Disse algoritmer bruger visionsteknologi til at opdage kantlinjer, forhindringer, fiducialmærker og farvekodede markører. De beregner også hastighed og retning, tilbyder navigationsinformation og giver præcis positionering. Ved at integrere disse algoritmer i bærbare enheder, mobilapplikationer og augmented reality-systemer, sigter forskerne mod at forbedre mobiliteten og selvstændigheden for svagtseende personer i både indendørs og udendørs miljøer.
